q: Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., ordered the report in a provision he added to last year's defense spending bill. The measure also directed the Pentagon to recommend ways to punish fraudulent contractors. But the report concluded that the department believes that existing remedies with respect to contractor wrongdoing are sufficient. `` It is clear that DoD's current approach is not working and we need far more vigorous enforcement to protect taxpayers from massive fraud,'' Bernie Sanders said in a news release. in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks
